custom_item_1.description: Check if Cisco IOS 12 is installed

custom_item_2.description: 1.1.7 Set 'aaa accounting' to log all privileged use commands using 'commands 15'
custom_item_2.info: Runs accounting for all commands at the specified privilege level.
custom_item_2.solution:
Configure AAA accounting for commands.
    hostname(config)#aaa accounting commands 15 {default | list-name | guarantee-first} {start-stop | stop-only | none} {radius | group group-name}

custom_item_3.info: Provides information about all outbound connections made from the network access server.
custom_item_3.solution:
Configure AAA accounting for connections.
    hostname(config)#aaa accounting connection {default | list-name | guarantee-first} {start-stop | stop-only | none} {radius | group group-name}

custom_item_4.info: Runs accounting for the EXEC shell session.
custom_item_4.solution:
Configure AAA accounting for EXEC shell session.
    hostname(config)#aaa accounting exec {default | list-name | guarantee-first} {start-stop | stop-only | none} {radius | group group-name}

custom_item_5.info: Runs accounting for all network-related service requests.
custom_item_5.solution:
Configure AAA accounting for connections.
    hostname(config)#aaa accounting network {default | list-name | guarantee-first} {start-stop | stop-only | none} {radius | group group-name}

custom_item_6.info: Performs accounting for all system-level events not associated with users, such as reloads.
custom_item_6.solution:
Configure AAA accounting system.
    hostname(config)#aaa accounting system {default | list-name | guarantee-first} {start-stop | stop-only | none} {radius | group group-name}

custom_item_8.description: 1.5.9 Set 'priv' for each 'snmp-server group' using SNMPv3
custom_item_8.info: Specifies authentication of a packet with encryption when using SNMPv3
custom_item_8.solution:
For each SNMPv3 group created on your router add privacy options by issuing the following command.
      hostname(config)#snmp-server group {group_name} v3 priv

custom_item_9.description: 1.5.10 Require 'aes 128' as minimum for 'snmp-server user' when using SNMPv3
custom_item_9.info:
Specify the use of a minimum of 128-bit AES algorithm for encryption when using SNMPv3.

       NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.

       NOTE: If performing an offline config audit this check may not show results.
custom_item_9.solution:
For each SNMPv3 user created on your router add privacy options by issuing the following command.
      hostname(config)#snmp-server user {user_name} {group_name} v3 encrypted auth sha {auth_password} priv aes 128 {priv_password} {acl_name_or_number}

custom_item_11.info: Define an authentication key for Network Time Protocol (NTP).
custom_item_11.solution:
Configure at the NTP key ring and encryption key using the following command
    hostname(config)#ntp authentication-key {ntp_key_id} md5 {ntp_key}

custom_item_12.info: Ensure you authenticate the identity of a system to which Network Time Protocol (NTP) will synchronize
custom_item_12.solution:
Configure the NTP trusted key using the following command
    hostname(config)#ntp trusted-key {ntp_key_id}

custom_item_13.info: Specifies the authentication key for NTP.
custom_item_13.solution:
Configure each NTP Server to use a key ring using the following command.
    hostname(config)#ntp server {ntp-server_ip_address}{key ntp_key_id}

custom_item_14.description: 2.4.1 Create a single 'interface loopback' - 'Only one loopback interface is defined'
custom_item_14.solution:
Define and configure one loopback interface.
    hostname(config)#interface loopbackhostname(config-if)#ip address

custom_item_15.description: 2.4.1 Create a single 'interface loopback' - 'Only one loopback interface IP Address is defined'
custom_item_15.solution:
Define and configure one loopback interface.
    hostname(config)#interface loopbackhostname(config-if)#ip address

custom_item_16.info: Force AAA to use the IP address of a specified interface for all outgoing AAA packets
custom_item_16.solution:
Bind AAA services to the loopback interface.
    Hostname(config)#ip {tacacs|radius} source-interface loopback {loopback_interface_number)

custom_item_17.description: 2.4.3 Set 'ntp source' to Loopback Interface - 'NTP is bound to loopback'

custom_item_18.description: 2.4.3 Set 'ntp source' to Loopback Interface - 'SNTP is bound to loopback'

custom_item_19.description: 2.4.3 Require Binding NTP Service to Loopback Interface - 'NTP/SNTP is bound to loopback'
custom_item_19.info: Use a particular source address in Network Time Protocol (NTP) packets.
custom_item_19.solution:
Bind the NTP service to the loopback interface.
    hostname(config)#ntp source loopback {loopback_interface_number}

custom_item_20.description: 2.4.4 Set 'ip tftp source-interface' to the Loopback Interface
custom_item_20.info: Specify the IP address of an interface as the source address for TFTP connections.
custom_item_20.solution:
Bind the TFTP client to the loopback interface.
    hostname(config)#ip tftp source-interface loopback {loobpback_interface_number}

custom_item_21.info: Disable proxy ARP on all interfaces.

custom_item_22.info: Verify no tunnel interfaces are defined.
custom_item_22.solution:
Remove any tunnel interfaces.
    hostname(config)#no interface tunnel {instance}

custom_item_23.info:
Examines incoming packets to determine whether the source address is in the Forwarding Information Base (FIB) and permits the packet only if the source is reachable through the interface on which the packet was received (sometimes referred to as strict mode).

      NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_23.regex: ip verify unicast source reachable-via rx

custom_item_24.description: 3.2.1 Set 'ip access-list extended' to Forbid Private Source Addresses from External Networks - 'Deny internal networks'
custom_item_24.info: This command places the router in access-list configuration mode, where you must define the denied or permitted access conditions by using the deny and permit commands.
custom_item_24.solution:
Configure ACL for private source address restrictions from external networks.
    hostname(config)#ip access-list extended {name | number}
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip {internal_networks} any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 127.0.0.0 0.255.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 10.0.0.0 0.255.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 0.0.0.0 0.255.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 172.16.0.0 0.15.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 192.168.0.0 0.0.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 192.0.2.0 0.0.0.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 169.254.0.0 0.0.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip 224.0.0.0 31.255.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny ip host 255.255.255.255 any log
    hostname(config-nacl)#permit {protocol} {source_ip} {source_mask} {destination} {destination_mask} log
    hostname(config-nacl)#deny any any log
    hostname(config)#interfacehostname(config-if)#access-groupin

custom_item_36.description: 3.2.2 Set inbound 'ip access-group' on the External Interface
custom_item_36.info: This command places the router in access-list configuration mode, where you must define the denied or permitted access conditions by using the deny and permit commands.

custom_item_38.info:
Define an authentication key chain to enable authentication for routing protocols. A key chain must have at least one key and can have up to 2,147,483,647 keys.
      NOTE: Only DRP Agent, EIGRP, and RIPv2 use key chains.
custom_item_38.solution:
Establish the key chain.
      hostname(config)#key chain {key-chain_name}

custom_item_39.info: Configure an authentication key on a key chain.

custom_item_40.info: Configure the authentication string for a key.

custom_item_41.solution:
Configure the EIGRP address family.
      hostname(config)#router eigrphostname(config-router)#address-family ipv4 autonomous-system {eigrp_as-number}

custom_item_42.info: Defines user defaults to apply to EIGRP interfaces that belong to an address-family.

custom_item_43.info: Configure the EIGRP address family key chain.

custom_item_44.info: Configure authentication to prevent unapproved sources from introducing unauthorized or false service messages.

custom_item_45.info: Specify the type of authentication used in Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP) packets per interface.

custom_item_46.info: Configure authentication to prevent unapproved sources from introducing unauthorized or false routing messages.

custom_item_48.solution:
Configure the Message Digest option for OSPF.
      hostname(config)#router ospfhostname(config-router)#areaauthentication message-digest

custom_item_49.info: Enable Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Message Digest 5 (MD5) authentication.

custom_item_51.info: Define an authentication key chain to enable authentication for RIPv2 routing protocols.
custom_item_51.solution:
Establish the key chain.
      hostname(config)#key chain {rip_key-chain_name}

custom_item_52.info: Configure an authentication key on a key chain.

custom_item_53.info: Configure the authentication string for a key.

custom_item_54.info: Enable authentication for Routing Information Protocol (RIP) Version 2 packets and to specify the set of keys that can be used on an interface.

custom_item_55.info: Configure the Interface with the RIPv2 key chain.
custom_item_55.solution:
Configure the RIPv2 authentication mode on the necessary interface(s)
      hostname(config)#interfacehostname(config-if)#ip rip authentication mode md5

custom_item_57.info: Enable message digest5 (MD5) authentication on a TCP connection between two BGP peers
custom_item_57.solution:
Configure BGP neighbor authentication where feasible.
      hostname(config)#router bgphostname(config-router)#neighborpassword
